A **monkey**, Y, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is a small [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivorous "Omnivorous") [apelike creature](/wiki/Apelike_creature "Apelike creature") that can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

A monkey has a claw attack that can [steal items](/wiki/Theft_\(attack\) "Theft (attack)") and a bite attack.

Monkeys can be tamed with [bananas](/wiki/Banana "Banana"), and additionally consider them a [treat](/wiki/Treat "Treat").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [3 History](#History)

- [4 Variants](#Variants)

  - [4.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [4.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [4.3 notdNetHack](#notdNetHack)
  - [4.4 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [5 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Randomly generated monkeys may be created as peaceful for [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") characters.

Five monkeys are generated in the Bazaar Town map of [Minetown](/wiki/Minetown "Minetown") at level creation, with two placed randomly and the other three occupying the room north of the central [fountain](/wiki/Fountain "Fountain").

Monkeys appear among the random Y that make up the second [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") for [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Healer quest](/wiki/Healer_quest "Healer quest").

## Strategy

Monkeys are not particularly fast, making chasing them down much less annoying compared to nymphs even if your character is somewhat burdened. Their theft attacks can also fail and give you time to kill them in melee before they can actually steal anything. Unlike nymphs, monkeys will not teleport after stealing and cannot steal [cursed](/wiki/Cursed "Cursed") items.

Early [Knights](/wiki/Knight "Knight") may want to take care in dealing with monkeys, as attacking a fleeing monster in melee incurs a small alignment penalty; using a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") to do the dirty work for you or attacking from range are both effective as an alternative.

## History

The monkey first appears in [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6"), and makes its vanilla debut in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), monkeys are considered fully can be generated in [real zoos](/wiki/Real_zoo "Real zoo").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), a monkey is one of two default starting pets for the [Pirate](/wiki/Pirate "Pirate") [role](/wiki/Role "Role").

Two monkeys are randomly placed on the upper filler level of the [Pirate quest](/wiki/Pirate_quest "Pirate quest") at level creation. Three monkeys are randomly placed on the Paradise Island map of [The Sea](/wiki/The_Sea_\(dNetHack\) "The Sea (dNetHack)") at level creation.

### notdNetHack

In [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), in addition to dNetHack details, 1⁄5 of monsters randomly generated on the [Archipelago](/index.php?title=Archipelago\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Archipelago (page does not exist)") [adventure branch](/index.php?title=Adventure_branch\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Adventure branch (page does not exist)") will be monkeys.

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, the [Corsair](/wiki/Corsair "Corsair") role in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") has a monkey as one of five possible starting pets.

Four monkeys are generated in the village of the [Town](/wiki/Town "Town") branch at level creation.

## Encyclopedia entry

"Listen, man-cub," said the Bear, and his voice rumbled like  
thunder on a hot night. "I have taught thee all the Law of  
the Jungle for all the peoples of the jungle--except the  
Monkey-Folk who live in the trees. They have no law. They  
are outcasts. They have no speech of their own, but use the  
stolen words which they overhear when they listen, and peep,  
and wait up above in the branches. Their way is not our way.  
They are without leaders. They have no remembrance. They  
boast and chatter and pretend that they are a great people  
about to do great affairs in the jungle, but the falling of  
a nut turns their minds to laughter and all is forgotten.  
We of the jungle have no dealings with them. We do not drink  
where the monkeys drink; we do not go where the monkeys go;  
we do not hunt where they hunt; we do not die where they die...."

\[ The Jungle Book, by Rudyard Kipling ]

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

Monkey

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Y monkey
Difficulty 4
Attacks Claw 0d0 steals, Bite 1d3 physical
Y monkey
Difficulty 4
Attacks

Claw 0d0 steals, Bite 1d3 physical

Base level 2
Base experience 17
Speed 12
Base AC 6
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 100
Nutritional value 50
Size Small
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A monkey:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is an animal.
  • is omnivorous.
  • can be seen through infravision.
Reference monst.c#line1918

A monkey, Y, is a type of monster that appears in NetHack. It is a small omnivorous apelike creature that can be seen via infravision.

A monkey has a claw attack that can steal items and a bite attack.

Monkeys can be tamed with bananas, and additionally consider them a treat.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 History
  • 4 Variants
    • 4.1 SLASH'EM
    • 4.2 dNetHack
    • 4.3 notdNetHack
    • 4.4 SlashTHEM
  • 5 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

Randomly generated monkeys may be created as peaceful for neutral characters.

Five monkeys are generated in the Bazaar Town map of Minetown at level creation, with two placed randomly and the other three occupying the room north of the central fountain.

Monkeys appear among the random Y that make up the second quest monster class for Healers and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Healer quest.

Strategy

Monkeys are not particularly fast, making chasing them down much less annoying compared to nymphs even if your character is somewhat burdened. Their theft attacks can also fail and give you time to kill them in melee before they can actually steal anything. Unlike nymphs, monkeys will not teleport after stealing and cannot steal cursed items.

Early Knights may want to take care in dealing with monkeys, as attacking a fleeing monster in melee incurs a small alignment penalty; using a pet to do the dirty work for you or attacking from range are both effective as an alternative.

History

The monkey first appears in SLASH 6, and makes its vanilla debut in NetHack 3.3.0.

Variants

SLASH'EM

In SLASH'EM, monkeys are considered fully can be generated in real zoos.

dNetHack

In dNetHack, a monkey is one of two default starting pets for the Pirate role.

Two monkeys are randomly placed on the upper filler level of the Pirate quest at level creation. Three monkeys are randomly placed on the Paradise Island map of The Sea at level creation.

notdNetHack

In notdNetHack, in addition to dNetHack details, 1⁄5 of monsters randomly generated on the Archipelago adventure branch will be monkeys.

SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, the Corsair role in SlashTHEM has a monkey as one of five possible starting pets.

Four monkeys are generated in the village of the Town branch at level creation.

Encyclopedia entry

"Listen, man-cub," said the Bear, and his voice rumbled like
thunder on a hot night. "I have taught thee all the Law of
the Jungle for all the peoples of the jungle--except the
Monkey-Folk who live in the trees. They have no law. They
are outcasts. They have no speech of their own, but use the
stolen words which they overhear when they listen, and peep,
and wait up above in the branches. Their way is not our way.
They are without leaders. They have no remembrance. They
boast and chatter and pretend that they are a great people
about to do great affairs in the jungle, but the falling of
a nut turns their minds to laughter and all is forgotten.
We of the jungle have no dealings with them. We do not drink
where the monkeys drink; we do not go where the monkeys go;
we do not hunt where they hunt; we do not die where they die...."

[ The Jungle Book, by Rudyard Kipling ]

A '''monkey''', {{monsym|monkey}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is a small [[omnivorous]] [[apelike creature]] that can be seen via [[infravision]].

A monkey has a claw attack that can [[theft (attack)|steal items]] and a bite attack.

Monkeys can be tamed with [[banana]]s, and additionally consider them a [[treat]].

==Generation==
Randomly generated monkeys may be created as peaceful for [[neutral]] characters.

Five monkeys are generated in the Bazaar Town map of [[Minetown]] at level creation, with two placed randomly and the other three occupying the room north of the central [[fountain]].

Monkeys appear among the random {{white|Y}} that make up the second [[quest]] [[monster class]] for [[Healer]]s and make up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Healer quest]].

==Strategy==
Monkeys are not particularly fast, making chasing them down much less annoying compared to nymphs even if your character is somewhat burdened. Their theft attacks can also fail and give you time to kill them in melee before they can actually steal anything. Unlike nymphs, monkeys will not teleport after stealing and cannot steal [[cursed]] items. 

Early [[Knight]]s may want to take care in dealing with monkeys, as attacking a fleeing monster in melee incurs a small alignment penalty; using a [[pet]] to do the dirty work for you or attacking from range are both effective as an alternative.

==History==
The monkey first appears in [[SLASH 6]], and makes its vanilla debut in [[NetHack 3.3.0]].

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
In [[SLASH'EM]], monkeys are considered fully can be generated in [[real zoo]]s.

===dNetHack===
In [[dNetHack]], a monkey is one of two default starting pets for the [[Pirate]] [[role]].

Two monkeys are randomly placed on the upper filler level of the [[Pirate quest]] at level creation. Three monkeys are randomly placed on the Paradise Island map of [[The Sea (dNetHack)|The Sea]] at level creation.

===notdNetHack===
In [[notdNetHack]], in addition to dNetHack details, {{frac|5}} of monsters randomly generated on the [[Archipelago]] [[adventure branch]] will be monkeys.

===SlashTHEM===
In addition to SLASH'EM details, the [[Corsair]] role in [[SlashTHEM]] has a monkey as one of five possible starting pets.

Four monkeys are generated in the village of the [[Town]] branch at level creation.

==Encyclopedia entry==

"Listen, man-cub," said the Bear, and his voice rumbled like 
thunder on a hot night.  "I have taught thee all the Law of
the Jungle for all the peoples of the jungle--except the
Monkey-Folk who live in the trees.  They have no law.  They
are outcasts.  They have no speech of their own, but use the
stolen words which they overhear when they listen, and peep,
and wait up above in the branches.  Their way is not our way.
They are without leaders.  They have no remembrance.  They
boast and chatter and pretend that they are a great people
about to do great affairs in the jungle, but the falling of
a nut turns their minds to laughter and all is forgotten.
We of the jungle have no dealings with them.  We do not drink

we do not hunt where they hunt; we do not die where they die...."
